pull.title: test: Change coinselection parameter location to make tests independent
pull.body: the `subtract_fee_outputs` param is expected to be `true` for all subsequent tests.  It should be defined outside of a single test so that if it's removed or changed, all subsequent tests won't fail.  Currently if you remove this [test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L304:L325) the following [test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L327:L345) fails.  This change makes the tests independent.

events.message: test: Change coinselection parameter location to make tests independent

events.body:
ACK b942c94d153f83b77ef5d603211252d9abadde95.
The first test does not use `coin_selection_params_bnb.m_subtract_fee_outputs`, thus can be removed there.
Verified that `coin_selection_params_bnb.m_subtract_fee_outputs = true` is required in subsequent tests.

@aureleoules thanks for pointing out that `m_subtract_fee_outputs` is _not_ used in that test.  After examining that test more closely, it doesn't seem to be testing wait it's supposed to be:

[// Test fees subtracted from output](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L317)

As you say, the param `subtract_fee_outputs` isn't being used.  In the first assertion the value being selected is [1 sat](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L313) while the second is using [1 * CENT](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L322) which is why there's a difference in the first and second assertion.  Also, there is no way to use a negative effective value like the [comment says](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L314).  There's a specific assert that precludes it [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/coinselection.cpp#L76).

All in all, maybe the [test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/test/coinselector_tests.cpp#L304:L325) should be removed in a future PR.  Another possibility is to fix it to test this [statement](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/coinselection.cpp#L368) which maybe was the original intent.

issue.title: test: Remove unused coin_selection param
issue.body: The param `min_viable_change` is never used in any of the subsequent tests and can be removed.

events.body:

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

tACK b942c94d153f83b77ef5d603211252d9abadde95

Verified that removing the test in question fails subsequent tests. Which signifies the expected value for `m_subtract_fee_outputs` is true for other cases.. 

One thought/question
Should we also perform a test with `m_subtract_fee_outputs = false` in bnb?

@rajarshimaitra my opinion is that `m_subtract_fee_outputs = false` isn't important to test since this is equivalent to saying the `cost of change` is `0` and as far as I know shouldn't happen.  Although others may have a better idea or feel different.
